addressleaf.section:
De Mons
r
Bodley le 26
me
de fevrier 1594 a mons
r
le Comte d'Essex
1594

page.lettertext:
fol.108r
Maie it please y
r
good L. here I send you the
Copies of two intercepted l
res
, having allso
sent the like unto my
L. T
re
r
. They were sent
from
Brussells
for
Rome,
& written by one
Willam Creytton
a scottishe Jesuit, a man of
creditt & experience, & the cheifest plotter, as
I have hard of these troubles in
Scotland.
One of the l
res
is addressed to cardinall
Caeten, & the other to the generall of the
Jesuites.
Thomas Tyrie
whoe is thought
to be the man
t
can doe them so much good, is
nephew to
James Tyrie
, in time past a famous
fessor amounge the Jesuites of
Paris,
but
now abiding in Rome. The L. Humes
& the wife of Thomas Tyrie, are brother & sisters
children.
Of all other matters I have written to y
r
L.
the 22
th
of this moneth. And so I take my
humble leave. From the Hage Feb 26 1594.
Y
r
L. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley.
